title: Calories in 1 Pound Ground Beef
meta_description: Discover calories in 1 pound ground beef, including protein, fat, carbs, full nutrition breakdown per 100g basis, and easy tweaks for leaner options.
assumptions: 80% lean / 20% fat, cooked (pan-broiled), drained of excess fat; no added salt, seasonings, or binders.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by lean percentage, cooking method, draining, brand, and portion accuracy. Check labels or use a food scale for precision.

quick_answer.text: 1 pound of cooked 80% lean ground beef provides ~1117 kcal and ~118 g protein.

label_note: Totals are scaled from the per-100 g basis and mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Add 1 tsp oil during cooking per 100 g

faqs.q: How many calories in 1 pound of 80% lean ground beef?
faqs.a: About 1117 kcal when cooked and drained.

faqs.q: What's the protein in 1 pound ground beef?
Does lean percentage affect calories in ground beef?
faqs.a: Yesâ€”90% lean has ~176 kcal per 100 g (vs. 246 for 80% lean), reducing total to ~799 kcal per pound.

faqs.q: Are these values for cooked or raw ground beef?
faqs.a: Cooked (pan-broiled). Raw is slightly higher at ~254 kcal per 100 g due to water loss during cooking.

faqs.q: How does cooking method change calories in ground beef?
faqs.a: Broiling or draining reduces fat/calories; frying without draining increases them by retaining more fat.
